oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Davidson County Courthouse, c.1940s
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the Davidson County Public Building and Courthouse, also known as the Metropolitan Courthouse, c.1940s. Built in 1936-1947, the building was constructed in the Art Deco style and designed by Nashville architect Emmons H. Woolwine and the firm of Dennison and Hirons of New York. The courthouse was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1987. Photographed by the Nashville Housing Authority. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
